The Ratings & Research Support department is responsible for producing analytical inputs in support of Moody’s Ratings and Research function. In addition, this department will provide support for surveillance requirements and partner with R&R to provide the necessary support for issuer and investor interactions.#LI-SG1Closing date: Sunday 25th July 2021 Job Description

The Role We are looking for an Associate Analyst (AA) to join the RRS – Sub-Sovereign Group. The role offers a unique career opportunity at the intersection of public finance and financial markets. Sub-Sovereign credit analysis and research span a wide range of entities: regional and local governments as well as entities related to various levels of government through ownership or guarantees: public universities, hospitals, public sector housing providers, utilities, government agencies, etc. The AA will provide high profile credit analysis and will form a holistic view on a portfolio of Sub-Sovereign entities in 2-3 EMEA countries. In addition to the rating activities, the team publishes in-depth research on relevant credit issues, also taking into account environmental, social and governance factors. The role, therefore, requires solid quantitative and qualitative analytical skills and a demonstrated interest in public finance. Applicants from all backgrounds are welcome. Our AAs have very diverse academic backgrounds including finance, accounting, economics and public policy/management. The ideal candidate for this role will possess a passion for public sector analysis and strong organisational skills, is able to balance big picture thingking and and attention to detail, and will enjoy working in a dynamic team environment. The AA3 position provides a unique opportunity to foster skills that are valuable to any future career in the financial services industry. Key ResponsibilitiesPerforming preliminary credit analysis to support ratings, research, as well as analytical outreach and other meetings. Analytical work includes:Interacting with intermediaries and issuers, attending analytical and outreach meetings with clients and investors (regional travel might be required) and assist with meeting follow-up reportsPreparing, analysing and interpreting financial and economic data, identifying trends and key factors that affect issuers’ credit quality, writing analytical commentary in accordance with Moody’s methodologies to support credit monitoring/surveillance and internal portfolio reviewsReviewing rating documentation, including financial statements, bank loans, covenants and bond indentures in preparation of Rating Committees, developing and formulating a solid analytical conclusionSupporting sector and issuer research writingPerforming a number or routine administrative and other ad hoc credit-related tasks QualificationsMinimum undergraduate/ first level degree (e.g. Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent qualifications) in a relevant field such as economics, public administration, social/political sciences, etc., a Master’s degree is an assetDemonstrated interest in public sector analysis/public finance through coursework or relevant work experienceSome prior experience in research writing, quantitative and qualitative analysisSolid verbal, written communication and interpersonal skillsFluency in English. An additional European language is desirable.Good quantitative and Excel skills Ability to adapt to a changing environment and prioritize tasks accordingly
